direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are fundamental for object comparison and hash-based collections, sharing similar logic for key handling and caching.
Both methods access and manipulate the internal keys array, which is central to the functionality of the MultiKey class.
Similar to getKey(int), this method also interacts with the keys array, providing a broader context for testing key-related operations.
Both methods involve processing the keys array and handling null values, sharing a similar control flow and exception handling approach.
This method recalculates the hash code, which is directly related to the equals method's functionality, especially after deserialization.
The size method provides information about the keys array, which is indirectly related to the equals method's comparison logic.
While not directly related to equals, the toString method provides a string representation of the keys, which can be useful for debugging and testing equality checks.
